inn1.comm: starts with a back of a length ball angling in, defended towards midwicket
one of Amla's favourite strokes in ODI cricket, the controlled glide down to third man for a single, South Africa are away
a touch short and outside off, Smith can work the ball to the leg side no matter how far outside off it is, he shuffles across and tucks this one towards square leg

dropped, big let-off for Smith at first slip, he top-edges a shortish ball outside off, it flies to Nicol at first slip, an overhead chance, simple one, it was high but it wasn't too quick, it goes through his hands, not the best of starts for New Zealand
works it to the leg side for a single
helped just wide of slip for a single
swinging in  but that take the ball down the leg side, it was a low full toss, nudged towards square leg
moves across the stumps and defends a delivery on middle and off
ore watchfulness from Amla, blocked to the off side
pushed towards mid-off and Amla pushes for a quick single, sprint through
grunts as he delivers that one, pitched up and just outside off, defended towards the leg side
length ball outside off, pushed towards cover
back of a length ball, 129.7kph, just outside off, crunched towards point, Williamson dives to his right to make a sharp stop
this time amla makes Williamson dive to his left, and gets it past the fielder as well, down towards third man
full and on the pads, whipped towards midwicket but can't find the gap
punched back past the bowler, not sure that was entirely intentional, a bit of a leading edge there, Amla was looking to play it to mid-on
length ball outside off, Smith moves across once more and tucks the ball in front of square leg
a slice of luck for Amla, once more he was looking to thump that to the leg side, takes a thick outside edge and sends the ball to the point boundary
more trouble for Amla, this one sneaks past the inside edge, stayed quite low as well, reaching McCullum on the second bounce, and the keeper can't collect cleanly

big lbw appeal, turned down, think it pitched outside leg stump, hit on the knee roll as amla looks to whip it to the leg side, the bowler says he think it pitched outside leg, and some other fielder says height might be an issue as well, turns out that would have been given out if they had referred it
way down the leg side
Amla not looking in any control, this time he jumps and looks to force the ball through the covers and inside-edges it past the stumps
a waft outside off this time and Amla is beaten by that 129kph delivery, a hint of away movement

Amla in a very aggressive mood here, wants to launch this towards midwicket but mistimes it badly and the balls rolls in that direction, a sharp second run is taken, for a moment New Zealand thought there was a run-out chance but smith makes it in time
muscled towards cover as Amla drives on the up
haven't seen too much defence from Amla so far today, this time he gets forward and blocks to the off side

Amla given lbw, will he refer it? Yes, he is. that was back of a length and angling towards leg stump, Amla was looking to drive that on the up, he misses and is struck on the back leg in front of middle stump, was it missing leg stump? the replays say stick with the umpire's call, and that ends Amla stay
Colin Ingram faces a bouncer first up, he ducks
back of a length delivery, worked to wide mid-on
a touch shorter, punched towards point by Ingram
hurl it full and on middle stump, defended towards mid-on
bangs it in short, around off stump, Ingram jumps to get on top of the bounce and blocks it down the pitch
133kph, just outside off and that is left alone
short of length ball just outside off, punched to cover
Mills bowls it well outside off stump, Smith not interested
back of length ball rears up outside off, Smith is struck on the thigh pad as he tries to work the ball towards midwicket
crisply struck by Smith off the back foot, slapped towards cover point but straight at the fielder
clipped to square leg this time, another dot ball
pitched up and well outside off, Mills has been just under 130kph today, this one is 129, defended to the off side
short of length ball outside off, once more Smith cuts off the back foot, can't find the gap
pushed towards mid-on for a single, Ingram is off the mark

McClenaghan gets his first ODI wicket, a moment to savour for him, that was plumb, once more smith looks to work an offstump delivery to the leg side, he misses and is struck in front of off, on the back leg as well, umpire doesn't take too long to raise his finger, even before that Smith was beginning to walk away
length ball outside off, de Villiers defended towards point
gets the ball to bounce a bit, a thick-inside edge onto the pads, bowler got that one to straighten a bit
pushed towards midwicket for a quick single, de Villiers gets going
length ball on the pads, 131.7kph, pushed towards midwicket for a single
short ball outside off is worked towards midwicket
defended towards midwicket once more
stands back in the crease and pushes the ball to the off side, a back of a length ball on off stump
pitched up and outside off, 130kph, eased towards cover point off the front foot, New Zealand keeping it tight here
short ball on legstump, speed gun says that is 39.4kph, pulled away behind square leg
pitched up, just outside off, defended to the off side to end the over

pitched up around off, very few bad deliveries so far today, there's not been any crazy movement, but there's has been very little width to work with for the batsmen, just outside off and that is defended
Ingram remains cautious, blocks down the pitch
a diving stop from Ronnie Hira at cover, a bit of room to free the arms, slapped by Ingram but can't get any runs for it
crisply struck on-the-up drive, towards extra cover, once again the placement isn't good enough and it is a dot ball
short and outside off, Ingram chases it and then lets it through to the keeper
short again, Ingram happy to duck under
starts with a length ball on middle and leg, eased to mid-on for a single
from round the wicket, length ball is defended off the front foot
inside-edge as he looks to drive through cover off the front foot, the ball rolls to the leg side
what a shot that is, AB de Villiers shows his class, a pitched up delivery and de Villiers going inside out against the turn, launching it over the infield, gets a boundary to extra cover
skips down and punches this along the ground to mid-off, only for a single though
looks to sweep the ball fine, can't get it past short fine

AB de Villiers gone lbw! massive wicket there, he was waiting on the back foot and looking to whip the ball towards square leg, he misses and is hit in front of middle stump, that length ball was going on to hit the stumps, but did it pitch outside leg, de Villiers thought so, he's not too thrilled with the umpire's decision, he'll have to walk off though, no reviews left, replays show that did pitch in line, no problem with that decision
a full ball is blocked by du Plessis
pitched up and outside off, that is left alone by du Plessis
overpitched this time, driven to extra cover for a single, du Plessis gets his first run
keeps it tight around off, defended off the back foot
pitched up, just outside off, defended by Ingram to end another excellent over from part-time model McClenaghan
looks to whip the ball to the leg side, leading edge towards the bowler
a flighted delivery is eased to long-on for a single, brings Ingram on strike, he's 4 off 24 now
tapped towards mid-off for a single
patted towards mid-on, where the fielder gets a hand on it but can't stop it cleanly
short, but not too short, Ingram bends as he chops that  behind point to bring up his first boundary, there have been too many fours so far this innings
full and outside off, helped towards sweeper cover
pitched up delivery is firmly driven towards mid-off
length ball on the pads from Franklin, Ingram moves across and pats the ball towards square leg
shot! short from Franklin, du Plessis waits for it and pulls that contemptuously to the midwicket boundary, that brings up South Africa's 50 as well
skips down the track and cracks the ball towards cover, a diving stop there by BJ Watling, full-stretch to his left
once more towards cover, once again there's no run
short of length ball on leg stump, defended down the track
not much spin on offer for McCullum yet, defended towards the bowler
flighted ball is punched towards mid-off
pushed back towards the bowler once more, Ingram finding it hard to rotate the strike here
looks to sweep that hard, towards deep square leg for a single
clipped to square leg but can't get a run
a bit of a leading edge sends the ball back towards the bowler, a good over that from N McCullum
full ball is crisply driven towards mid-off
shortish ball outside off, 125kph, slapped towards point off the back foot
pitched up and that is another dot ball, pushed to mid-on this time, a big stroke round the corner from Ingram?
keeps it steady around off stump, 127kph, blocked to the off side
short of length and just outside off, Ingram stands tall and defends towards cover
a maiden from Franklin, the last ball of the over is defended towards backward point, Ingram 12 off 39 now
full ball on off stump, driven towards long-on off the front foot for a single
flighted ball, slower through the air, defended towards extra cover
quicker and flatter, Ingram looks to cut but can't get the gap
there's the big hit from Ingram, you could sense it coming, a big, clean hit after skipping down the track, launches that over the bowler's head and towards the sightscreen for six
full toss, flighted and outside off, punched past extra cover for four, Ingram moves into the 20s
on the pads, tucked in front of square leg for a single
short of length ball on off stump, defended from the crease towards point
leading edge, Ingram was looking to nudge the ball from outside off towards the leg side, a leading edge sends it towards gully
slightly slower from Franklin, rolling his fingers across the seam, 117kph, defended by Ingram
shortish and just outside off, enough width for Ingram to slash it towards deep backward point
nicely don by du Plessis, takes a couple of paces down the track before opening the face to guide the ball towards third man
poor ball to finish the over, slanting down the leg side, helped towards fine leg for a couple
pitched up and that is wristily worked towards long-on
down the leg side, Ingram sweeps but can't get it past short fine leg
quicker on middle and leg, defended to the leg side
pitched on a length and outside off, defended towards cover
full and on the pads, eased down to long-on for a safe single
length ball on the pads again, a quiet over from Williamson, worked towards square leg
length ball outside off, defended towards cover by du Plessis
shortish ball just outside off, du Plessis goes for the pull, not off the middle, hits high on the bat, was in the air for a bit, not too far from Guptill at midwicket, but far enough to be safe
worked from outside off behind square leg
pitched up, just outside off stump, defended off the front foot to the off side, that was 125kph from Franklin
skips down the track to get near the pitch of the ball, clipped towards deep square leg

that is chipped towards deep extra cover after du plessis advanced down the track, not timed perfectly but it initially seemed to have enough to reach the rope but a rapid N McCullum pulls that back just in time
full ball is worked towards wide mid-on
down the track, waits for the ball to arrive and nudges it towards square leg
length ball from round the stumps, defended towards square leg
similar delivery, this time it is worked behind square leg for a single
a powerful drive is stopped athletically at covers, good work that

Ingram is gone to an outstanding catch from Nathan McCullum, he went for a big sweep, top-edged it and the ball went high in the air, swirling around, McCullum had to run backwards from midwicket  to get under it, not easy to judge that one, initially looked like he overran it, but he collects it cleanly
solidly defends his first ball in ODIs
length ball is worked towards midwicket, "5 and 6 here lads, let's go lads," are the shouts of encouragement from the NZ fielders
nudged to midwicket this time, plenty of chat from the NZ fielders
length ball just outside off, punched to mid off

short of length ball, drives it on the up towards long-on, sends mid-on on a long chase, gets three, just gets three, a direct hit from the deep could have got him out, but he dives to make his ground
a sign of du Plessis' confidence, walking across the stumps to take the ball from well outside off towards midwicket
pitched up, and that is defended by du Plessis off the front foot
more watchful defence from du Plessis
du Plessis shuffles across, taps the ball towards square leg for a single
length ball outside off, whipped towards mid-on for a single
full ball outside off, a wristy stroke sends the ball towards deep square leg
short from Williamson, de Kock charged down the track and had to check his stroke, defends

how was that not a run-out? some abysmal cricket there, a terrible delivery to start, down the leg side, McCullum does well to get a hand on it, both batsmen were almost at the same end as de Kock had come charging out, McCullum fires in the ball towards the bowler Neesham who has completed his follow-through, Neesham can't collect it cleanly, it bobs out of his hand and rolls away, there is still time to get the run-out, the throw from Neesham is low towards the bowler's end, not easy to take that one for N McCullum, and after that major confusion South Africa still have de Kock and du Plessis in the middle
full and slow ball just outside off, tapped to midwicket
a touch shorter outside off, nudged to midwicket
down the leg side, du Plessis lets the ball through to the keeper after taking a couple of steps down the track
wide outside off, helped towards deep backward point
a mistimed drive from de Kock towards midwicket
defended from the crease to the off side to end the over
flighted ball is punched to short extra cover
shorter one, worked to backward square leg off the back foot for a single
short ball outside off, slapped towards sweeper cover
shuffles across to send the ball from outside off towards square leg
a touch short and that is crashed towards point, not placed properly
on off stump, defended from the crease, just three off that Williamson over
a flamboyant drive from du Plessis, on the up and that sends the ball towards sweeper cover, brings up South Africa's 100
once more du Plessis shows he's not afraid to work the ball from outside off to the leg side, helping this towards midwicket
outside off, looksto help it along to third man, but can't work it past backward point
short of length ball is driven over the bowler's head, not too well timed but well enough to send that slower one over the head of mid-off, it was the offcutter from Neesham
short of length and outside off, bottom edges it towards the keeper
a good-looking stroke from de Kock, a crisp drive towards cover but BJ Watling is there to cut it off
worked towards square leg for a single, thought about the second but settle for one
pitched up and outside off, that is sliced down towards third man
length ball on off stump, worked towards square leg

another drop in the slip, this time it is Guptill, regulation chance at first slip, a healthy edge through from de Kock, it was around knee-height, should have been taken, Guptill slams the turf in frustration
pitched up and de Kock wants to power it towards midwicket, inside-edges it towards square leg instead
pitched up and just outside off, defended towards cover by du Plessis
patted towards midwicket, du plessis charges down but de Kock says 'no,no,no,' to send him back
super shot there from de Kock, short of length and a bit of width, de Kock gets forward and throws his bat at it, sends that ball over extra cover to the boundary
pitched up and that is driven towards mid-on by de Kock
back of a length ball outside off, slapped towards point
well outside off, too wide for the umpire's liking, but B McCullum is not happy with the decision, du Plessis wanted to thrash that through the off side
helped towards midwicket for a single
short ball is confidently pulled towards deep square leg for a single
pitched up and that is driven towards extra cover
defended to the leg side by de Kock
short of length ball on off stump, awkwardly defended towards midwicket
gets some late swing in towards off stump, it was a full delivery that was jammed out by de Kock
looked to drill that down the ground, mistimed though, mid-on and mid-off converge on it, only a single
angling in from round the wicket, defended by du Plessis down the track
slants that down the leg side
on the pads once more, helped along down to fine leg
short of length ball outside off, stops on the batsman a bit, worked towards midwicket
fuller length ball just outside off, de Kock slaps it to point

is that taken cleanly? the fielder Nathan McCullum certainly thinks so, he's off on a celebratory run, de Kock mistimed a lofted drive, that was dying on McCullum as it reached him at mid-off, thought it might drop short but it was a fantastic take from McCullum, somehow managing to get his fingers under that low chance, he had to cover plenty of ground to his left as well, one of those rare occasions when the TV replays sow clearly whether the ball went straight into the hand or bounced just in front
short of length ball nearly goes past the bat, inside-edged towards the leg side
an outside egde, the ball loops towards cover
full and on the pads, looks to work it behind square but misses

massive lbw appeal as McCullum bowls from round the wicket, turned down, referral time, that was pitched up and McLaren was looking to drive to mid-on, he misses and is struck low on the front foot, that hit him in front of leg stump, but was going on to miss leg stump, so McLaren survives
punched off the front foot towards mid-off
on middle and leg stump, clipped towards square leg for a single
full delivery is punched back to the bowler
length ball outside off, worked towards midwicket, and another quiet over from New Zealand
defends that back of length ball down the track
back of length ball on off stump, defended to the off side from the crease
pitched up and that is driven towards mid-off but can't beat the fielder
a bit of width, and that is guided towards backward point for a sharp single
down to short third man for a single
length ball on off stump, defended from the crease to the off side
"right opportunity to attack them lads," says B McCullum as du Plessis defends a full ball on middle stump
blocked to the leg side for a single
pitched up and that is defended towards midwicket
stretches forward and blocks that to the off side
McLaren showing the sceptics (including me) that he can bat, skips down and plays a lofted inside-out drive to send the ball over extra cover, didn't try to smash that one
pushed back carefully towards the bowler
outside off, du Plessis waits for it and helps it along to third man for a single
was that a chance, Franklin seems to think so but couldn't detect an edge there, it was outside off and came in just a touch, beating franklin's bat, McCullum can't collect that one
a leading edge sends the ball looping to the vacant point region
another edge, another shout of 'catch it,' lands safely around cover
gets on the front foot and pushes towards cover, can't get a single
length ball outside off, whipped towards midwicket for a single
110kph to start, back of a length ball just outside off, defended
back of the length again, "bowling TS," shouts McCullum as du plessis blocks that to midwicket
on the pads and that is worked towards short fine leg
punched towards cover, another diving stop
looks to power it through the off side, can't time it and the ball rolls towards the bowler
a slower ball from a bowler who has been around the 110kph mark this over, that delivery was only 83kph, full and on the pads, worked towards square leg
on the pads, to deep square leg for a single
short of length ball well outside off, mistimed towards mid-off
full and well outside off, a forceful drive towards cover, can't place it though
punched towards mid-off for a single
chops that from outside off towards third man for a single
low full toss outside off, du Plessis sends that towards extra cover
a stifled lbw appeal, but that struck du Plessis outside off, he was walking down the track, off the pad for a leg bye
McLaren sees the short ball, winds up for the pull and dispatches that to the wide long-on boundary, powerfully struck
goes deep in the crease and tucks the ball towards square leg for a single
short of length ball outside off, slapped towards backward point by du Plessis
there's cover point and backward point and that is slapped fiercely between the two for four, 'Don't stop believing,' is the song the DJ plays at the stadium after that shot
a bouncer that is much too high
short of length ball on off stump, defended to the off side
almost a yorker, on off and middle, squeezed out towards the leg side
short of length ball on middle, worked towards midwicket, a sharp single is taken, could have been tight if Guptill had collected that cleanly
full and on middle, jammed towards the leg side once more
plays the lap sweep this time, no power on it as he scoops that down towards fine leg after getting on one knee
fires it down the leg side, this partnership working well for South Africa
punched towards mid-on for a single
pitched up and on the leg stump, glanced down to fine leg, McLaren immediately shouts 'Two, two, two," and he gets two
full ball just outside off, du Plessis cramps himself by moving across the stumps, works the ball behind square leg
full and outside off, carved down towards deep extra cover, an early call for two and du Plessis zips back for the second
bowled from wide of the crease, and that ball is too wide outside off, just outside the marker line
a yorker heading for off stump, dug out towards cover
high full toss, and he has overstepped, might have been too high as well, du Plessis gets it away towards point

sensational way to get to a well-deserved half-century, skips across the stumps and paddles it perfectly past short fine leg for four, noticed that fine leg was in the ring and he takes advantage, du Plessis' purple patch continues
worked to short fine leg for a single this time
shouts of "catch it" as McLaren thumps the ball towards cover, tough chance for Williamson whpo had to dive forward to get his hands on that low one, he can't latch on to it
length ball is eased towards long-on for a single
length ball on off stump, defended to the leg side
pitched up and that is driven towards long-on for a single
a stylish hit from du Plessis, skips down the track and slaps it down to long-on
slower ball, out of the back of the hand, full and outside off, punched towards extra cover
worked towards deep midwicket for a single, a good day so far for Franklin
slapped towards backward point  by McLaren
another fielding mistake from Guptill, he takes a step to his right after McLaren punches the ball to his left  at midwicket

turn for Williamson, seemed to have spun past McLaren's outside edge, can't see anything on the HotSpot, there's a loud appeal for caught-behind though, and it is upheld, the partnership is snapped at 59. McLaren has done his bit with the bat though
length ball outside off, opens the face to guide the ball towards backward point
length ball outside off, defended solidly off the front foot
full and just outside off, defended towards point, just two off the over and a wicket
short of length ball is worked towards mid-on, sprints through for a single

McLenaghan is all smiles after he gets Peterson lbw, that one swerved in after pitching just outside off, Peterson offers an awkward prod but is struck in front of off, that was going to take the top of middle, duck for Peterson
length ball outside off, sneaks past the bat and through to the keeper
135kph from McLenaghan, pitched up and that is defended towards mid-on
slants that down the leg side
length ball outside off, defended back towards the bowler
short of length and angling across, Kleinveldt think about playing that one but withdraws his bat at the last moment
full and just outside off, pushed back towards the bowler
on the pads, whipped behind square leg
spins in after pitching on middle, du Plessis makes room and slaps the ball towards point
full ball down the leg side, off the pads and towards short fine

and Kane Williamson strikes once more, du Plessis is goen and south Africa now unlikely to bat out their full quota, it was on the pads, du Plessis didn't want to power that one, just chipped it towards wide long-on, 'catch, catch, catch,' was the plea from the bowler, Nicol does well, getting his hands under it as the ball dropped on him, that was another solid innings from du Plessis, who is quickly becoming an indispensable member of the team in all formats
flighted ball is clipped towards midwicket
131.4kph, full and outside off, pats the outside edge and through to the keeper, McClenaghan's impressive debut continues
again he beats the outside edge from round the wicket, this is short of a length and just outside off

does the trick on the third time, a yorker on off and middle and off stump flies out of it's place and is lying on the turf a few yards out, a fourth for McClenaghan, a debut to savour, can he make it a fifer?
a full ball heading for off stump, defended by Tsotsobe

pitched up and again heading for off stump, squeezed towards backward point, easy single to be had, the batsmen strolled to the middle, meeting midway before Kleinveldt asks Tsotsobe to go back as he wants strike in the next over, can Lonwabo keep out the final delivery
he can, defends to the leg side, and McClenaghan finishes with 4 for 20, the best figures for a New Zealand bowler on debut
too wide outside off, scythed through extra cover for four
looking to launch this towards midwicket, can't get bat on it

an outside edge, short third man puts in a dive but can't stop it completely, goes down towards the third man boundary, South Africa gets two, could have got a third but Kleinveldt sends back Tsotsobe
defended down the track this time
full ball on middle and leg, eased towards long-on for a single
in the slot and that is hammered to the deep midwicket boundary by Kleinveldt, that a long boundary there and he clears it comfortably, South Africa getting closer towards 200
back-to-back sixes to bring up the 200, a fierce hit sends that length ball over long-off for six more
slugs a full ball to deep square leg and then declines the single

the crowd has been subdued for much of today, now they have found their voice, thanks to the third six of the over from Kleinveldt, muscular flat hit to the midwicket boundary after Mills pitches short
slower yorker, only 100kph that one, Kleinveldt adjusts and defends for a single towards mid-on
pitched up, looks to drive, inside-edge sends the ball towards the leg side
length ball following the batsman, defended to the leg side
the Kleinveldt show is over, it was down the leg side, he swipes it towards deep square leg where Mills takes the catch to wrap up the South Africa innings on 208

inn2.comm: length ball swings away just a bit, defended to the off side

already one reason why de Villiers shouldn't be keeping, a scorching direct hit hands Guptill a diamond duck, that T20 century will seem a long, long time ago now, Nicol punched the ball towards cover and set off, de Villiers swooped in and fired in a perfect throw, Guptill had no chance whatsoever
huge lbw appeal from Steyn, the others are less interested, that was sliding down the leg side

dropped, this match hasn't had the best exhibition of slip catching, the pitched up ball that moves away late, takes the outside edge and goes low towards Smith at second slip, he dives to his left but can't snaffle that one, Smith is usually a first slip fielder, now in second
defended off the front foot towards cover
length ball heading for off stump, 136kph, defended back down the start, a superb over from Steyn to start the innings
a legstump half-volley swinging down the leg side, helped to fine leg for four
short of length ball well outside off, left alone
flirting with that one outside off, and nearing nibbling it through to the keeper, short of length and rising, beats the bat

missed a catch at slip? no problem, another one will come along soon enough, Nicol nearly edged the previous delivery behind, this time he get a thick edge, comes slowly to Smith at second slip, was quite low but was still quite easily taken, New Zealand's two openers are gone
outside off and that is left alone by Williamson
pitched up, too wide outside off to worry Williamson

short of length ball on the pads, whipped towards the square leg boundary for four, nicely done by 
Watling
way down the leg side
length ball on off and middle, defended towards midwicket
short of length ball outside off, guided towards deep backward point
a bouncer from Steyn, Williamson belatedly decides to duck,  too slow and he is struck just below the shoulder
more confident this time, defending towards cover
a 141kph to finish the over, Williamson spots it early and bends well in time
shortish ball angling across, Watling gets across the stumps and defends down the track
that one rises more than Watling expects, off the handle, just above the shoulder of the bat, loops towards backward point but lands well short
nearly the outside edge there, goes across with the angle and he's beaten
full and wide outside off, easy leave for Williamson
again too wide to worry Williamson
much better from Tsostsobe, on a length and heading for off stump, defended off the front foot towards cover
defended towards cover off the front foot
spot-on from Steyn, on a length and shaping away just a touch, defended towards the bowler
more defence as steyn keeps targetting that off stump
just a fraction outside off this time, Williamson stays on the backfoot and pokes the ball towards backward point
another short ball from Steyn, 144.2kph, on off stump line, Williamson ducks in time
another bouncer to finish off the over, 145kph, Williamson happy to duck
stands tall and punches that towards cover, still can't get a run
short of length ball just outside off, punched towards extra cover, where Peterson scores a direct hit though he has only one stump to aim at
a short ball is pulled away by Williamson, lifts his front leg as he plays that shot, and he keeps it along the ground as well
steers it past a diving backward point for a single
length ball outside off, sliced towards deep backward point
Williamson takes a couple of paces across the stumps as he looks to play that one, he can't connect with a back of length delivery
beaten past the inside edge first up, a short of length ball well outside off, that stayed a touch low
struck on the pads but that was high and going down the leg side, so not much of an appeal
back of a length ball at 137.7kph, defended towards midwicket
whips it from off stump towards square leg, can't find the gap
another dot ball, runs scarce here for New Zealand, Watling slaps this one towards cover
an effortless punch to the right of the bowler beats the diving mid-on fielder, and races away for four, some relief for New Zealand
and another one bites the dust, Williamson's forgettable tour with the bat continues, shortish ball outside off, cuts that one but straight to du Plessis at cover point, New Zealand are 21 for 3
defended off the back foot towards the bowler
length ball outside off, pushed towards cover off the front foot
'great start, great start,' shout the south Africa fielders after he sends down a length ball that is left alone outside off
short and wide, that is slapped towards deep point for four, one of the few bad deliveries this innings
drives on the up, a firm hit but it can't beat the man at covers, a diving stop from de Villiers
short ball outside off, McCullum arches backward as he tries to power the ball over point, he misses, and de Kock can't collect that cleanly, bounces off his palm to the ground
there's the shot McCullum plays so well, absolutely monsters that one through the covers, it was pitched up and that reaching the boundary in no time, serious power there
shortish and outside off., bottom-edges it and McCullum thinks for a second that that might go back on his stumps, bounces past
loopy ball from Peterson, twirls it behind square leg for a single
defended off the front foot towards cover
length ball spinning away after pitching on off stump, defended off the front foot towards point
on the pads, whipped towards square leg
length ball on off stump, batsman shuffles across and tucks that towards square leg
pitched up and that is punched towards cover
short and wide, Mccullum throws his bat at it and misses
length ball on off stump, pushed towards cover for a single
pitched up and outside off, forced towards sweeper cover for a couple
inside-edges that one, almost back on to the stumps, onto the pads
full ball outside off, pushed towards point this time
shortish ball, Watling goes for the pull and misses, struck on the body
flighted delivery pushed into the gap, 50 comes up for New Zealand
smashes that towards cover but can't beat the fielder there
driven by McCullum, back towards the bowler, that the end of the over
over the wicket, Watling drives towards cover
a direct hit there but there's no problem, even the third umpire is not called for, McCullum was safe there
a single by pushing the ball deep on the leg side
defended by McCullum, McLaren keeps it tight
a tickle down the leg side for four, was there any bat on that? nope, only pads
a no-ball as McLaren oversteps, McCullum blocks that to the leg side
that is smashed over long-off, McCullum shows how to deal with a free-hit, absolutely murders that one, and it is time for drinks
McCullum drives a flighted delivery towards cover, no run
mistimes it as he looks to hit it over the top, along the ground towards the midwicket boundary for a single, 71 for 3
Peterson to Watling, who turns it towards Ingram at square leg, 72 for 3
punches that to the extra cover boundary for a single, 73 for 3

McCullum is gone lbw, Kleinveldt strikes, that was a good length delivery that swerved back in, struck on the back foot, McCullum spoke to the umpire about a review, but it seems that the lack of power at the ground means all the tools of the referral system can't be used, McCullum will have to walk off, this is bizarre scenes from Boland Park, doesn't reflect too well on the organisation
a bouncer and that is high, too high for Elliott to reach
a superb delivery that jags in a touch, Elliott lets that through on the height
a yorker from Kleinveldt, that is down the leg side, and that is another wide, New Zealand 75/4
a rising delivery just outside off, left alone by Elliott
full and straight, full face of the bat as that is kept out
that snakes in a long way, strikes him on the full, big lbw appeal, but it is turned down, South Africa are absolutely convinced that is out, but again the lack of power means there can be no replays
outside off and that is left alone by Elliott
81/4 after the 19th over
on a fuller length, batsman pushes it to the on side and there is no run
and another New Zealand wicket goes down, Kleinveldt strikes, Elliott edges it towards Smith at slip and New Zealand are in deep trouble at 81 for 5
new batsman is James Franklin, down the leg side to start, they get a free run
short of length ball just outside off, slapped towards point
pitched up and that is driven towards extra cover
looks to pull that one, can't connect properly and they get a single

oh dear, is that another one? and the most unfortunate way to go as well? a push back towards the bowler, Kleinveldt manages to get a hand on it, deflects it on to the stumps, Watling has survived though with a superb dive to get back in time
slapped behind point for a single
length ball just outside off, defended off the front foot to the off side
skips down the track and chips it towards long-off for a single
defended off the front foot to the off side
plenty of flight on that one, on a length and that is worked towards deep point
straightaway he is on target, on off stump, on a length, defended back towards the bowler
short of length ball outside off, punched towards extra cover off the front foot
swerves in from a length, pitching just outside off, defended off the front foot
short of length ball angling in once more, Wat;ling does well to keep that out, 'Well bowled, Dale steyn,' shouts the keeper de Kock
shortish ball outside off, pulled away towards deep square leg for a single
length ball just outside off, defended towards cover
slants in towards the pads, punched off the back foot towards midwicket, 'Wait in,' is the call
flighted delivery, that is on a length and just outside off, defended off the front foot
too short from Peterson, frankly a rubbish delivery, nearly got him a wicket though, as the batsman nearly pulls that all the way to the fielder at deep midwicket, lands short though
hastens that through, straighter one, outside off stump and beats the outside edge
franklin moves across the stumps and tucks the ball behind square leg
length ball is eased towards long-off for a single
back of length and outside off, Watling goes for the cut and misses
Steyn getting close to a wicket here, gets the inside-edge this time, almost back onto the stumps, Watling again looking to cut though there wasn't much width available
short and uncharacteristically wide from Steyn
back to his accurate best, on a length and heading for off stump, solid forward defensive
defended towards the off side off the front foot
a touch shorter, on middle and off stump, tucked towards square leg
short and that is down to fine leg
Tsotsobe bowls it wide and that is driven through the extra cover region for four by Watling,
from round the wicket, chipped towards cover
too straight from Tsotsobe, worked towards Smith at midwicket
punched off the back foot, fielded by de Villiers
on the pads, full ball is worked towards deep square leg for a single
starts with a wide down the leg side
driven towards cover this time
short of length ball outside off, guided down towards third man
length ball heading for the off stump, defended back towards the bowler

there's another one, and the important one of BJ Watling, New Zealand's chances take a huge hit, short of length ball well outside off, looks to chop that through the off side, bottom-edges it back onto the stumps
length ball from round the wicket, worked towards midwicket

and another one, New Zealnd clearly not liking these power cuts and want to leave this ground as soon as possible, short of length ball, Neesham was looking to play across the line, stayed in his crease as he tried that, he missed and is struck on the knee roll, in front of off, and that was going on to hit middle and off
short of length ball just outside off, defended towards the off side
a tentative poke outside off, past the outside edge
full ball slanting down the leg side, off the pads towards the square leg
on leg stump, McCullum walks across the stumps and glances down to fine leg, there's a dive from Steyn at the boundary, but it isn't enough to keep the ball in
pitched up and just outside off, worked towards square leg for a couple
shuffles across and whips this towards the midwicket boundary, this was a full ball on off and middle, a gutsy shot from McCullum
a length ball is inside-edged, the ball bounces and hits Franklins forearms and rolls to the off side, a quick single is taken after McCullum calls for it
sprays it down the leg side again, plenty of extras from South Africa
short of length and outside off, looks to chop that through the off side, bottom edges it and it bounces through to the keeper
length ball heading for off stump, defended watchfully
short ball outside off, a controlled glide sends the ball to the third man boundary, 14 off 6 deliveries now McCullum
slants in towards leg stump, tapped towards midwicket, followed by a loud 'No,' to let Franklin know there's no single
jumps to get on top of the bounce, pats it towards backward point, Franklin dashes across in search of a single, McCullum doesn't and Franklin has to scramble back. time for drinks
defended watchfully off the front foot
worked to midwicket for a single
back of a length on middle and off, whipped towards midwicket
flighted and full, looks to drive that one, can't connect properly
on off and middle, nudged towards square leg for a single
big appeal for lbw, that was high and outside off as well, so no real trouble for McCullum there
short of length ball on off stump, defended back towards the bowler
length ball just outside off stump, clipped towards deep square leg
short ball outside off, from round the wicket, Franklin allows it through to the keeper
loud lbw appeal again, that was heading down the leg side, New Zealand get leg byes
New Zealand aren't down and out, McCullum showing plenty of fight, he skips down and lofts that over mid-on for four, not a shot with too much power, just enough to clear the infield
stays on the back foot and tucks the ball to square leg
flighted length ball, clipped towards midwicket by Franklin, superb diving stop from  du Plessis
worked towards midwicket again
is a bit slow to reach the batsman, Franklin punches it towards long-on
towards extra cover for a single to complete the over, the partnership is now over 30
short and too far wide outside the off stump, that moved away quite a bit after pitching
length ball well outside off, guided towards backward point
stayed a touch low, slanting in towards the pads, from round the wicket, that was going down the leg side
another wide down the leg side, de Kock dives to take that
another wide down the leg side, Kleinveldt grunts with the effort as he fires that one down
defended solidly off the front foot towards cover
wide outside off this time, Franklin leaves the ball that moves away from him

is that the end of Franklin? Tsotsobe takes the catch at mid-on, but he isn't sure he has taken that, replays needed, that was a length ball that Frankling sends looping towards Tsotsobe at mid-on, he had to dive forward to clasp that low chance, he has his fingers are under the ball but did a part of the ball touch the ground? tough call this for the third umpire, and as it happens so often in these cases, the batsman gets the benefit of the doubt

referral time as McCullum is given out lbw, looked plumb though, that one from McLaren swings in late, struck low on the front pad in front of middle stump, that was going to shave leg stump, replays say that was an umpire's call, and that stays out, McCullum has to go
edged down towards third man for a single
from round the wicket, that was full and heading for off stump, Franklin keeps it out
another extra, McLaren oversteps, an unconvincing defence from Mills, the ball rolls past the stumps

free-hit, short ball outside off, and that is top-edged over the keeper, Quinton de Kock does a superb job of chasing after that, he has to hare all the way to rope and make a dive to keep that in, well done Quinton
poked towards point for a single
defended towards cover off the front foot
defended to the off side by Franklin
short of length ball just outside off, defended to the off side by Franklin
another loud lbw appeal, full delivery  from Kleinveldt, that was going down the leg side
pitched up, on middle and off, punched towards long-on for a three
goes for the yorker, swings in, ends up as a low full toss, jammed towards mid-on for a single
short of length ball on legstump, tucked behind square leg for a single
pitched up and heading for off stump, defended towards the leg side by Franklin, who is patient as ever, no trying any fancy strokes
length ball outside off, swings away a touch, worked towards backward point
on the pads, tapped towards midwicket
short ball from McLaren to test out Franklin, who gets inside the line of that 139kph delivery and ducks under
length ball on the pads, worked towards mid-on
on the pads, that is helped along to midwicket for a couple, a chance to attack Mills at the start of the next over
no footwork as Mills swishes at one outside off, he misses
pitched up and swinging away, defended from the crease towards cover
back of a length ball on off stump, Mills manages to keep that out
a stifled appeal for caught-behind, that moved away after pitching and beat the bat, terrific delivery from Steyn
back of a length delivery on off stump, blocked from the crease to the off side
short ball is pulled away towards deep backward square leg for a single, just one off that over
massive, Mills shows how much powerful he is, a short of length ball is clobbered over the bowler's head and towards the sightscreen for a huge six
inside-edges that length ball towards mid-on
a bit of width and that is scythed towards sweeper cover for a couple, some confused calling but there make it safely
punched towards cover off the front foot
poor delivery, Franklin capitalises, that was full and down the leg side, easy to just glance it along to the boundary
back of a length ball on off stump, defended back towards the bowler
length ball moving away, Mills is beaten outside off
on a length and on off stump, defended back down the pitch
on the pads, length ball and that is defended to the leg side
short of length ball outside off, slapped towards cover point
steyn relentless around that off stump, back of a length ball is blocked to the off side
short of length ball outside off, slapped towards short cover, and that's a maiden from Steyn
full and well outside off, stabbed down towards third man by Franklin
shortish ball that Mills looks to squeeze towards the leg side, can't get bat on it, off the pads towards the off side
short of length ball outside off, defended towards backward point
same length, just outside off, deflected to the leg side
slips in the full ball after those shorter ones, almost sneaks through, swinging in and gets a thick inside-edge onto the pad
slides it down the leg side, and extras' contribution increases by one more
length ball on the pads, tucked towards square leg for a single, New Zealand need another 38, South Africa still seek those two wickets
Steyn is accurate as ever, a length ball just outside off, defended to the off side
length ball on off stump, guided down towards third man for a single
full and outside off, blocked towards cover by Franklin
pitched up and outside off, inside-edged down to fine leg for one more
short ball just outside off, 'Take that Dale Steyn,' says Mills as he pummels that to the midwicket boundary, what a pull shot from the No. 10 batsman
pitched up, on middle and leg, worked towards square leg, New Zealand 32 away
length ball outside off, driven towards long-off for a single
length ball is defended to the leg side
on off stump, blocked towards the bowler
plenty of flight there from Peterson, not so much spin for him though, just outside off, pitched up, towards backward point for a single
length ball is worked from outside off towards midwicket
a low full toss is punched back to Peterson
pushed towards cover, where AB de Villiers fields and almost gives away an overthrow, it is backed up near the square leg boundary
two more for New Zealand, Franklin opens the face to guide that towards third man for a couple, more confused calling but no problem ultimately for New Zealand
squeezes this length ball towards midwicket for a single

144kph from Steyn, huge lbw appeal, that is given not out , referral, pad first and then the bat, that pitched back of the length and outside off, swerves in and hit him on the knee roll in front of middle, the replays shows that would just about take the bails, that means it is the 'umpire's call', which reprieves Mills
an angry Steyn charges in and bowls a shortish ball, 146kph, Mills swings and misses

is that a run-out? South Africa are subdued, and they have reason to be as Franklin is well in, that was sliding down the leg side, Quinton de Kock had to move to his left to collect that, NZ want to sneak a single, de Kock effects a direct hit but that isn't enough to prevent the run
flighted and full on middle stump, pushed to mid-on for a single
length ball just outside off, tucked towards square leg
flighted and full, eased towards long-on for one more
shorter and outside off, poked towards cover for one more, New Zealand fans begin to believe
full ball just outside off, worked towards midwicket
defended to the leg side by Franklin, Peterson finishes his spell

and he's done the job, in spectacular style, that arrows in towards middle stump, length ball that Mills wanted to work to the leg side, he misses and middle stump is out of the ground, South Africa  at last get the breakthrough, the fans at Boland Park love it
a full ball just outside off, defended from the crease to the off side
almost the outside edge there, McClenaghan is searching for that one outside off, McLaren has the ball jagging around, too good for the No. 11
again the ball leaves McClenaghan and he pokes at it, again beaten
sprays that down the leg side
pitched up and that is defended towards the off side, well done by the No. 11
more forward defence from McClanaghan, over to Franklin now
superb shot from Franlin, a pitched up delivery and that is thumped back past Steyn for four, to the left of the bowler, and wide enough of mid-on to get four

only 13 away now New Zealand, consecutive boundaries for Franklin, thatwas a thick outside -edge from Franklin as he looked to drive a length ball outside off, de Kock dives but it is beyond him and away to the third man boundary
guides this towards deep backward point for two more
length ball just outside off, defended to the of side by Franklin
length ball on off stump, eased towards long-on for a single
short of length ball outside off, the outside edge is tantalisingly close but the No. 11 survives again, Steyn's 10 are done
what. a. shot. James Franklin take a bow, a short ball just outside off, Franklin chips it over the keeper, no force at all in that shot, all finesse as he picks up four more
off the pads and down to fine leg for two leg byes, one boundary away now New Zealand!
low full toss on off stump, thumped back to the bowler, McLaren bends low to collect that

Franklin has done it! sensational stuff in Paarl, he has thrashed that through point for four, South Africa can't believe it, the New Zealand dressing room is jubilant, south Africa looked in control for much of the chase but the final few wickets just didn't arrive, Franklin remained incredibly calm all through the chase, didn't attempt any big strokes through much of his innings, sticking to the drives down the ground and nudges around for single
